page.title: 12Droxford Country Fair
page.content: At{Droxford Country Fair}in 1985 on the "rec" the people all had a good time.Plenty of stalls and sideshows. There was a procession led by the Royal Marines' Band.I was a Victorian girl on a float like an old classroom Kate was the Teacher,we said our ABC and tables.There were no dogs or cats but there were hot dogs.The fair is always on the first Sat in June.There was a craft tent,Mini_motor bikes a blow up wall.There was a raffle and cream teas.The money made was Â£1291.54 the Guides need a new flag (mice ate theirs) the village hall needs paint_ ing,the church needs money for kneelers & the Scouts need hike tents A fair queen was chosen at a disco in May.About 60 people work hard all year for the fair.They like it to be a fun day.{Sheepdog trials}held by A32 on Sept 21st.
